Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: bombardér

English

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From bombard +‎ -er.

Noun

[edit]

bombarder (plural bombarders)

  1. One who bombards.
  2. A high-voltage transformer used in neon signage.

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From bombarda +‎ -er.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [bum.bərˈde]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [bom.bərˈde]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [bom.baɾˈðeɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Noun

[edit]

bombarder m (plural bombarders, feminine bombardera, feminine plural bombarderes)

  1. bomber (soldier)

Noun

[edit]

bombarder m (plural bombarders)

  1. bomber (aircraft)

Further reading

[edit]
  • “bombarder”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From bombarde +‎ -er, from Middle French bombarde, ultimately from Latin bombus.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /bɔ̃.baʁ.de/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

bombarder

  1. to shell, blitz

compound — simple imperative of avoir + past participle — simple imperative of avoir + past participle simple imperative of avoir + past participle —
1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Derived terms

[edit]
  • bombardement
  • bombardier

Further reading

[edit]
  • “bombarder”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Norman

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

(This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

Verb

[edit]

bombarder

  1. (Jersey) to bombard

Norwegian Bokmål

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

bombarder

  1. imperative of bombardere

Serbo-Croatian

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /bombǎrdeːr/
  • Hyphenation: bom‧bar‧der

Noun

[edit]

bombàrdēr m inan (Cyrillic spelling бомба̀рде̄р)

  1. bomber (bombing plane)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of bombarder
singular plural
nominative bombàrdēr bombarderi
genitive bombardéra bombardera
dative bombarderu bombarderima
accusative bombarder bombardere
vocative bombarderu bombarderi
locative bombarderu bombarderima
instrumental bombarderom bombarderima
